meanings.definition: (Latin) to regard as of little worth or account; to despise, contemn, slight, set light by.
meanings.english_definition: (Latin) to regard as of little worth or account; to despise, contemn, slight, set light by.

etymology.value: From Latin vilipendere, from vilis (cheap, worthless) + pendere (to weigh, consider).

verb_forms.present_indicative: vilipendo, vilipendis, vilipendit, vilipendimus, vilipenditis, vilipendunt
verb_forms.past_indicative: vilipendi, vilipendisti, vilipendit, vilipendimus, vilipendistis, vilipenderunt
verb_forms.present_subjunctive: vilipendam, vilipendas, vilipendat, vilipendamus, vilipendatis, vilipendant
verb_forms.past_subjunctive: vilipenderem, vilipenderes, vilipenderet, vilipenderemus, vilipenderetis, vilipenderent

usage_notes.explanation: 'Vilipendo' is a Latin verb meaning to consider something as worthless. It is not commonly used in modern English, but it can appear in academic or historical contexts.

readability_explanation.text: This is a Latin word, not commonly used in modern English. Understanding requires knowledge of Latin.
